author: Staff Reporter
text:
To strengthen democracy, the role of electors is very important. Hence, all should cast their vote and exercise their democratic right and ensure 100 per cent polling, said District Election Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy here.

Democratic

values

At an awareness campaign held on the Tamil Nadu Veterinary and Animal Sciences University premises here on Friday, the Collector said that the country is known for its democratic values as the government is elected through fair and free elections through voting.

“The basic thing in the entire process is voting and electors should ensure that their name is in the voters list”, he added.

Addressing the young voters, he said that the eligibility to be a voter is completion of 18 years of age and being an Indian citizen.

Apart from enrolling themselves through special camps, new voters can visit the portalwww.elections.tn.gov.inand complete the process.

In 2011, the number of electors in the district was 13.60 lakh that had increased to 17.26 lakh in 2016.

“About 73 per cent of the total population are electors”, he added.

He said that steps are taken to enrol over 30,000 new electors in all the colleges in the district.

He called upon the youngsters to enrol themselves as electors so that the can exercise their democratic right.
title: Ensure 100 per cent polling: Collector
